column2: ENGLISH
While on a border patrol, a courtier won a great victory against a hostile force. He tore through a number of enemies, like a true Dwarf should!
I could have done just as well.
While patrolling, this courtier's troops encountered many enemies of our hold. Instead of standing to fight, he fled and left his brothers to die! He brought shame on his family!
Imprison him! His fate shall be decided later.
Underneath every Dwarf hold, there are uncountable caves and tunnels, holding forgotten secrets. Will you join the tunnel fighters and explore them?
Time to go tunneling!
Whatever the cause, you were maimed by forces from below. The tunnelers, seeing you as a threat and a burden, lead you back home. No more tunneling for you.
Ah, well. I brought honour to my clan nonetheless.
You have been underground for a long time now and amassed great wealth in the meantime. Perhaps it is time to rest for now, before your luck runs out?
Yes, time to go home and see to my wealth...
No, I must continue tunneling!
Do you wish to stop searching the tunnels, and return to your home?
While searching the tunnels, your group happens upon an unknown opening in the wall. Do you want to look into it?
Better to leave this alone.
We won't get rich as cowards! On we go!
As you delve into the tunnel, you see some new ore deposits. As proof, you grab some nuggets and mark the location on your map.
One for me, one for Pa...
As you delve into the depths, you keep looking for something worthwhile. Suddenly, you hear warning calls from behind - It's a dead end, and a trap! You will have to fight to get out of there!
Fight for our lives!
Suddenly, wild screams echo through the tunnels. A horde of Night Goblins descends upon your crew! What will you do?
Jump into the fray! There is no honour for cowards!
Better leave that to the professionals...
You join into the shield wall of the other fighters, and soon the Night Goblins are upon you! Strength and discipline against fury and masses...
For Grimnir, and our Ancestors!
You are not as experienced as the others, and you are aware of it. You decide to leave these ones to them, and stay behind the shield wall.
Good job, you guys! Let them have it, and get us out of here!
You and the others fight on, but in the end, there are just too many Goblins. They are EVERYWHERE, and your group tries to fall back...
We have to survive this! Fall back!
In the end, they are still just Goblins. Your group easily takes down a few dozen, and the rest run for their lives. In the end, you killed most of them!
Hah! That was nothing. You should see me when I'm serious...
While searching the tunnels, your men come upon an ancient structure of your kin. They are wary of searching it, fearing ambushes or other threats. What will you do?
Go ahead and enter the place myself. We have to find out what this was for!
Leave this be. We do not want to disturb anything.
You enter the unknown building, but don't recognize anything. Kicking open one door, you find the sarcophagus of another Dwarf. You just desecrated a tomb!
Curses!

As you enter the building, you recognize some of the runes on the entrance. And the engravings on the inside. This is an old shrine of Grungni! You immediately begin a prayer, and then search for relics of old to take home, to safety.
We have truly been blessed by him!
You have been wounded, and can no longer carry on searching the tunnels with the others. It is time to return home.
If I have to...
Go tunneling, discovering what there is to find underground.
Return from tunneling towards your hold.
Go tunneling
Return from tunneling
Searching underground
Searching through the depths for treasure and relics.

You have taken some time to look at things, and realized that the High Kingdom needs a new push to reunite. You're both known and renowned enough to give that push and be elected by a council of kings as the new High king. Will you call the others to your court?
Yes, the time has come!
No, things are fine right now!

The messengers quickly reach every hold that the Dwarfs still maintain - A Hold King called for a Council of Kings, something not done in centuries, to elect a new, proper High King. The other kings at least humour the meeting, it seems.
This Dwarf, renowned and powerful from what you heard, has called a Council of Kings and declared his High Kingship true and the old line powerless. Do you assist this claimant?
Yes, let the holds stand united once more!
No, I'll never accept this beardling as my King!
You have sworn to serve the new High King, and therefore, the old kingship is of no importance anymore.
My High King, I declare your word as truthful and accept your declaration of High Kingship. Let Karak Ankor reunite and the enemies of our clans tremble!
Well said. Have an Ale, and slay the Greenskins!
You declare your unwillingness to serve a usurper High King, but many of your clan aren't entirely with you on that...
Bah, let them grumble!
I will never willingly serve you, Pretender-King! Son of a Grobi Shaman and a She-troll! Come and face us, if you dare...
Well, we'll see how he fares alone!
Claim the High Kingship
Call in the Council of Kings, to declare yourself High King!
Word spreads around the world quickly - a Dwarf proclaimed his right to rule as the High King, and the other Dwarfs are gathering to agree or reject his terms. A new age for the Dwarfs might dawn...
